intro: Diplotaxis gomez-campoi, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and basal rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that disperse easily. Diplotaxis gomez-campoi is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
